title: Understand What a Binomial Coefficient Is
text: A binomial coefficient, such as C(n,k), represents the number of ways to choose k elements from a set of $$n$$ elements without regard to the order of selection.

title: Recall the Formula
text: The formula to calculate C(n,k) is $$n!$$ divided by (k! times $$(n-k)!)$$. This helps us determine how many ways there are to choose k elements from a set of $$n$$ elements.

title: Calculate 25!
text: Start by calculating $$25$$ factorial, which is the product of all integers from $$25$$ down to $$1$$.

title: Calculate 11!
text: Now calculate $$11$$ factorial, which is the product of all integers from $$11$$ down to $$1$$.

title: Determine 14!
text: Also calculate $$14$$ factorial, as it is part of the denominator in the formula for the binomial coefficient. It's the product of all integers from $$14$$ down to $$1$$.

title: Put it All Together
text: Using the values you calculated, evaluate the formula $$C(25,11)$$ as 25! divided by (11! times 14!).
